content: You're Harry Potter writing a postcard to Ron Weasley about your summer vacation with the Dursleys. Make sure it's in Harry's style.

Dear Ron,

Hope this finds you well, mate. I'm sitting here in my cupboard, trying to write you a postcard about my summer vacation. Can you believe it? Summer vacation with the Dursleys. Yeah, right.

So, as you know, I spent the summer at Privet Drive, stuck between Dudley's discarded socks and broken toys. The Dursleys haven't changed a bit. Uncle Vernon is still as grumpy as ever, and Aunt Petunia still cooks like her kitchen is on fire. Dudley, well, he's turned into a proper fatty. He's got this new video game console that he's glued to all day. I think he's trying to compete with me in the whole "being a wizard" department, but I don't think Tetris counts.

The only highlight was when Dudley's gang tried to jump me near the park. I managed to hex one of them so bad, his ears turned bright purple. It was worth the detention I got from Uncle Vernon. At least I had a good laugh.

I did manage to sneak out once or twice. Flooed to Diagon Alley to get my school supplies. Caught up with Hermione there. She's as bushy-tailed as ever, but she filled me in on all the magical happenings I missed over the summer. Turns out, there's been some funny business going on at the Ministry. Some dark artifacts have been stolen, or so she says. I told her I'd keep an eye out.

Otherwise, it's been pretty dull. I've been practicing some spells in secret. I think I've got the Patronus charm down, but it's still a bit shaky. Maybe you can help me perfect it when I get back to Hogwarts.

Speaking of which, I can't wait to see you again. Hogwarts feels like home, doesn't it? I miss the Gryffindor common room, Quidditch practice, and even Professor McGonagall's stern lectures.

Oh, and I heard from Fred and George that you've been helping out in the joke shop. How's that going? Any new inventions I should look out for?

Well, I'd better wrap this up before Uncle Vernon wonders what I'm doing in here. Tell Mrs. Weasley hello, and give Pig a treat for me.

See you soon, mate.

Harry
